mwi_subscription.tooltip: If you would like to control which voicemail box the indicator turns on for enter the mailbox number here.  If you leave this blank it will indicate for any voicemail assigned to the user.

number_of_line_keys.tooltip: Sets the number of line keys for this account to appear on the device.

use_geoip.tooltip: Enables or disables geolocation by IP address to set primary/secondary addresses and ports.

srtp.tooltip: Enables or disables attempts to encrypt the voice (RTP) of initiated phone calls.  Requires the PBX to also be configured with this option.

show_missed_calls.tooltip: Enables or disables the phone to record missed calls for this line.

hour_24.tooltip: This setting determines how the time displays on the phone's screen. Select 12:00 a.m. / p.m. to display the time in 12-hour clock notation (for example, 1:00 p.m.). Select 24 to display the time in 24-hour clock notation (for example, 13:00).

timezone.tooltip: Choose the time zone where the phone is located.

dhcp_time.tooltip: Enables or disables the phone to prefer the time zone offset obtained from the DHCP server.

primary_server.tooltip: Choose the primary SNTP server that the phone obtains the time from.

secondary_server.tooltip: Choose the secondary SNTP server that the phone obtains the time from.

resync_period.tooltip: The period of time (in seconds) that passes before the phone resynchronizes with the SNTP server.

format.tooltip: This setting determines how the date displays on the phone's screen. You can display the day, month, and year in a variety of formats.

http.tooltip: Enables or disables the user to access web user interface of the IP phone using the HTTP protocol.

https.tooltip: Enables or disables the user to access web user interface of the IP phone using the HTTPS protocol.

provisioner.tooltip: Replaces default Provisioning URL with a custom one for white labeling.

firmware.tooltip: Replaces default Firmware URL with a custom one.

digitmap.tooltip: All digits that are entered on the phone will be compared with the digitmap specified. If the digits match a digitmap pattern, the call will be automatically placed, without the Send key being pressed.

digitmap_timeout.tooltip: This setting controls how long, in seconds, each pattern in the digitmap is applied.

per_line_key.tooltip: This setting determines the total number of calls a line key can have at any one time.

custom_overrides_dir_url.tooltip: This setting allows for custom OVERRIDES_DIRECTORY

custom_config_url.tooltip: This setting allows for custom config files to be uploaded which will overwrite settings set via Provisioner

custom_log_dir_url.tooltip: This setting allows for custom directory to store log files

custom_contacts_dir_url.tooltip: This setting allows for custom contacts directory

custom_call_list_dir_url.tooltip: This setting allows for custom call list directory

custom_profile_dir_url.tooltip: This setting allows for custom user profile directory

enable_speed_dial.tooltip: This setting define if a mac-directory.xml will be created

static_ip.tooltip: The IPv4/IPv6 address when the IP address mode is configured 'static'.

static_netmask.tooltip: The IPv4/IPv6 subnet mask when the IP address mode is configured 'static'.

static_gateway.tooltip: The IPv4/IPv6 default gateway when the IP address mode is configured 'static'.

primary_server.tooltip: The primary DNS server used when the IP address mode is configured 'static'.

backup_server.tooltip: The secondary DNS server used when the IP address mode is configured 'static'.

voip_enable.tooltip: It enables or disables VLAN for the Internet (WAN) port.

voip_id.tooltip: The VLAN ID for the Internet (WAN) port when enabled, should be a value between 1 and 4094.

pc_enable.tooltip: It enables or disables VLAN for the PC (LAN) port.

pc_id.tooltip: The VLAN ID for the PC (LAN) port when enabled, should be a value between 1 and 4094.

filtering.tooltip: If VLAN filtering is enabled received Ethernet packets are filtered by VLAN so the TCP/IP stack doesnt process invalid data or too much data. Note that VLAN filtering is not supported on the VVX family of phones.

lldp_compatibility.tooltip: If enabled the phone will attempt to determine its VLAN ID and negotiate power through LLDP.

cdp_compatibility.tooltip: If enabled the phone will attempt to determine its VLAN ID and negotiate power through CDP.

dhcp_vlan_disc.tooltip: If disabled, no VLAN discovery is attempted via DHCP. When Fixed, the predefined DHCP vendor specific option values of 128, 144, 157 and 191 are checked.  If Custom the provided DHCP VLAN option is checked.

dhcp_vlan_opt.tooltip: The DHCP private option to use when DHCP VLAN Discovery is set to Custom.

udp_keep_alive.tooltip: Enables or disables keep-alive packets sent by the phone through the NAT device to keep the communication port open.

udp_keep_alive_interval.tooltip: The frequency (in seconds) to set a keep-alive packet.

pc_port.tooltip: Enables or disables the PC (LAN) port.

label.tooltip: The text label displays adjacent to the associated line key.

value.tooltip: The line configured under settings.feature_keys.account will subscribe to this URI for dialog information.

type.tooltip: If normal, the default action is to initiate a call if the user is idle or busy and to perform a directed call pickup if the user is ringing. Any active calls are first placed on hold. If automata, the default action when is to perform a park/blind transfer of any currently active call. If there is no active call and the monitored user is ringing/busy, an attempt to perform a directed call pickup/park retrieval is made.

format.tooltip: Configures the call information display method when the phone receives an incoming call, dials an outgoing call or engages in a call.

enabled.tooltip: Enables or disables the phone to play a warning tone when a new voice mail is waiting.
Enables or disables the phone to play a warning tone when there is a call on hold.

delay.tooltip: The interval (in seconds) at which the phone plays a hold tone when there is a call on hold.

enabled.tooltip: Enables or disables call waiting feature.

tone.tooltip: Enables or disables the phone to play the call waiting tone when the phone receives an incoming call during a call.

allow.tooltip: Enables or disables the automatical answering of incoming intercom call.

mode.tooltip: Controls how the phone handles intercom calls.

internal.tooltip: It configures the desired internal ringtone.

external.tooltip: It configures the desired external ringtone.

type.tooltip: Legacy means it's off without callflows/feature code setup. Native works automatically.
Set default transfer type to Attended or Blind

enabled.tooltip: Enabled appends '+' to the beginning of the number dialed.

handsfree_persist.tooltip: If disabled the speakerphone volume will automatically reset to a nominal level after each call, when enabled the volume level will remain that of the previous call.

handset_persist.tooltip: If disabled the handset volume will automatically reset to a nominal level after each call, when enabled the volume level will remain that of the previous call.

headset_persist.tooltip: If disabled the headset volume will automatically reset to a nominal level after each call, when enabled the volume level will remain that of the previous call.

heading_aid.tooltip: If enabled the phone audio Rx (receive) equalization is modified for hearing aid compatibility. If disabled audio Rx equalization is normal.

memory_mode.tooltip: Enable or disable the Headset Memory Mode. When enabled, audio from a new call is routed through the headset by default and the headset key on the phone lights up. When you end that call, the headset key on the phone stays lit and audio of all subsequent calls is routed through the headset. To turn the Headset Memory mode off, choose Disable or press the headset key on the phone keypad.

ehs_compatibility.tooltip: The Electronic Hookswitch mode for the phones analog headset jack.

directory_names.tooltip: When enabled, names from the local contact directory will be used to identify inbound and outbound calls. When disabled, names provided through the network signaling will be used to identify inbound and outbound calls.

show_vm_summary.tooltip: When disabled voicemail is immediately dialed when you press the Messages key. When enabled, the Message Center summary screen displays for you to dial into your voice mail. Not available on SoundPoint IP 320 and 330 phones.
